title: Torvill and Dean Honored with Damehood and Knighthood in New Year Honours
summary: Ice skating legends Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean have been awarded a damehood and knighthood, respectively, in the New Year Honours list, recognizing their outstanding contributions to ice dancing. They famously won gold at the 1984 Winter Olympics in Sarajevo with a perfect-scoring performance to Bolero, and have also secured multiple world and European titles. Additionally, Sarina Wiegman, the manager of England's women's football team, receives an honorary damehood for leading the Lionesses to consecutive European Women's Championship victories in 2022 and 2025. The honours extend to other athletes, including members of the Lionesses squad like Leah Williamson, who is appointed a CBE, and players from England's Women's Rugby World Cup-winning team. The New Year Honours list celebrates achievements across various fields, highlighting the impact of sports figures on national pride and inspiration.

The honours system includes ranks like MBE (Member), OBE (Officer), CBE (Commander), and knighthood/damehood, each reflecting different levels of achievement.
